CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 6, 1940, pg. 12 reads: " Bill Robinson, Actor And Ambassador Of Goodwill, Spends A Busy Week In Smoketown - When the "Hot Mikado" Bill "Bojangles" Robinson came to town, Pittsburgh received him as a superb dancer, an unsurpassed entertainer, a 61-year-old- man who has brought joyful tears to the eyes of millions of people. But Pittsburgh got more than the dancer, the entertainer and the comedian.  Shown here are some pictures of Bo as he identified himself with the civic and social life of the city, a veritable goodwill ambassador.  In picture....Bill as the Hot Mikado, surrounded by his dancing girls.
TitMainTitle: Bill "Bojangles" Robinson and female cast members on stage in Nixon Theater in production of "The Hot Mikado," with pagoda painted on wall in background
